description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
This Funding Opportunity Announcement (FOA) will focus on six countries in the region, including three Tier I countries with the highest HIV disease burden: Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago, and Guyana. Tier II countries include Barbados, The Bahamas and Suriname. Technical assistance (TA) and support will be provided through an Implementing Partner to the Ministries of Health as they move towards ad Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. objectives

This Funding Opportunity Announcement (FOA) will focus on six countries in the region, including three Tier I countries with the highest HIV disease burden: Jamaica, Trinidad and Tobago, and Guyana. Tier II countries include Barbados, The Bahamas and Suriname. Technical assistance (TA) and support will be provided through an Implementing Partner to the Ministries of Health as they move towards adopting and implementing Test and Start. This mechanism will aim to understand/assess PLHIV loss to follow up (particularly for key populations), implement innovative strategies to maximize retention in care, improve ART adherence and improve access to viral load testing and counseling. Technical assistance activities will focus on men who have sex with men (MSM), sex workers (SW), transgender individuals (TG) and PLHIV. This implementing mechanism will also adapt and refine the Vigilancia Centinela de Infecciones de Transmisión Sexual (VICITS) model, which is a combination prevention intervention approach linked to analysis of KP-specific surveillance data. VICITS will be expanded to include activities related to Test and Start at priority SNUs, with a particular focus on retention in care and ART adherence. Through this mechanism, support will also be provided to national and subnational high priority SNU sites to ensure sustainable systems and decrease barriers to treatment access, to support the early initiation of ART for all PLHIV. Technical assistance efforts will be tailored to the country-specific development context and readiness for implementation of Test and Start, with the eventual goal of graduation from PEPFAR support. Support will be provided to the MOH to strengthen retention in care and treatment services; strengthen ART adherence and viral load adherence

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
